intro: Heterotheca vandevenderorum, commonly known as the Vandevender's heterotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
